member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.InjectMeAttribute
member.summary: Use the InjectMe attribute to mark fields, properties or parameters of methods to be injectable by some (soon to be implemented) dependency injection framework. For the time being these values need to be set hardwired somewhere and the attribute us just intended as a markter.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.FuseeApplicationAttribute
member.summary: Use the FuseeApplication attribute to mark RenderCanvas derivatives as applications that can be collected by Application browsers.

member.summary: The name of the currently selected application.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.FuseeApplicationAttribute.Description
member.summary: The description of the currently selected application.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.ColorUint
member.summary: Represents a 32-bit color (4 bytes) in the form of RGBA (in byte order: R, G, B, A). Seen as a 32 bit unsigned integer, each color is in the form AARRGGBB - so the most signifcant byte is Alpha and the least significatn byte is the blue channel

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.ColorUint.R
member.summary: The red component of the color.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.ColorUint.G
member.summary: The green component of the color.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.ColorUint.B
member.summary: The blue component of the color.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.ColorUint.A
member.summary: The alpha component of the color.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.ColorUint.Lerp(Fusee.Engine.ColorUint@,Fusee.Engine.ColorUint@,System.Single,Fusee.Engine.ColorUint@)
member.summary: Performs a linear interpolation between two colors.
member.param: Value between 0 and 1 indicating the weight of .
When the method completes, contains the linear interpolation of the two colors.
member.remarks:
This method performs the linear interpolation based on the following formula.
start + (end - start) * amount
Passing a value of 0 will cause to be returned; a value of 1 will cause to be returned.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.ColorUint.Lerp(Fusee.Engine.ColorUint,Fusee.Engine.ColorUint,System.Single)
member.summary: Performs a linear interpolation between two colors.
member.param: Value between 0 and 1 indicating the weight of .
member.returns: The linear interpolation of the two colors.
member.remarks:
This method performs the linear interpolation based on the following formula.
start + (end - start) * amount
Passing a value of 0 will cause to be returned; a value of 1 will cause to be returned.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.ColorUint.SmoothStep(Fusee.Engine.ColorUint@,Fusee.Engine.ColorUint@,System.Single,Fusee.Engine.ColorUint@)
member.summary: Performs a cubic interpolation between two colors.
member.param: Value between 0 and 1 indicating the weight of .
When the method completes, contains the cubic interpolation of the two colors.

member.summary: Performs a cubic interpolation between two colors.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.ColorUint.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the component at the specified index.
member.value: The value of the alpha, red, green, or blue component, depending on the index.
member.param: The index of the component to access. Use 0 for the alpha component, 1 for the red component, 2 for the green component, and 3 for the blue component.
member.returns: The value of the component at the specified index.
member.exception: Thrown when the is out of the range [0, 3].

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.IInputDriverImp
member.summary: The InputDriver is used to manage different implementations of input devices. As different input devices require different implementations, this is necessary to have only one interface. So one InputDriver can hold multiple instances of one specific implementation.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.IMeshImp
member.summary: Interface for Mesh implementations. The implementation should handle typical mesh informations like: vertices, triangles, normals, colors, UV's. It is also required to implement a connection to the current Rendercontext in order to apply the Mesh for rendering. The Mesh should preferable use handles for its informations in order to communicate with a rendercontext. The handles are refering to so called BufferObjects.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IMeshImp.InvalidateVertices
member.summary: Implementation Task: Invalidates the vertices of the mesh, e.g. reset the VertexBufferObject of this instance by setting it to 0.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IMeshImp.InvalidateNormals
member.summary: Implementation Tasks: Invalidates the normals of the mesh, e.g. reset the NormalBufferObject of this instance by setting it to 0.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IMeshImp.InvalidateColors
member.summary: Implementation Tasks: Invalidates the colors, e.g. reset the ColorBufferObject of this instance by setting it to 0.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IMeshImp.InvalidateTriangles
member.summary: Implementation Tasks: Invalidates the triangles, e.g. reset the ElementBufferObject of this instance by setting it to 0.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IMeshImp.InvalidateUVs
member.summary: Implementation Tasks: Invalidates the UV's, e.g. reset the UVBufferObject of this instance by setting it to 0.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.IMeshImp.VerticesSet
member.summary: Implementation Tasks: Get a value indicating whether [vertices set].
member.value: true if VertexBufferObject is not 0; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.IMeshImp.NormalsSet
member.summary: Implementation Tasks: Gets a value indicating whether [normals set].
member.value: true if NormalBufferObject is not 0; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.IMeshImp.ColorsSet
member.summary: Implementation Tasks: Gets a value indicating whether [colors set].
member.value: true if ColorBufferObject is not 0; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.IMeshImp.TrianglesSet
member.summary: Implementation Tasks: Gets a value indicating whether [triangles set].
member.value: true if ElementBufferObject is not 0; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.IMeshImp.UVsSet
member.summary: Implementation Tasks: Gets a value indicating whether [UVs set].
member.value: true if UVBufferObject is not 0; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.INetworkConnection
member.summary: Interface for a network connection object.
member.remarks: Implementation tasks: A network connection has to implement functionality to send messages via a network and to disconnect.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.INetworkConnection.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects this instance from the remote end point.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.MessageDelivery

member.summary: Unknown type = 0

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.MessageDelivery.Unreliable
member.summary: Unreliable = 1, Packets can get lost and the order doesn't have to be correct.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.MessageDelivery.UnreliableSequenced
member.summary: Unrealiable Sequenced = 2, Packets can get lost, if an older(order) packet is received after a new one it(the older) is deleted.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.MessageDelivery.ReliableUnordered
member.summary: Reliable Unordered = 3, Packets don't get lost andthe order doesnt have to be correct.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.MessageDelivery.ReliableSequenced
member.summary: Reliable Sequenced = 4, Packets don't get lost, if an older(order) packet is received after a new one it(the older) is deleted.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.MessageDelivery.ReliableOrdered
member.summary: Realiable Ordered = 5, Packets don't get lost and are always transmitted in correct order.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp
member.summary: The render context interface contains all functions necessary to manipulate the underlying rendering hardware. Use this class' elements to render geometry to the RenderCanvas associated with this context. If you are worked with OpenGL or DirectX before you will find many similarities in this class' methods and properties.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.CreateShader(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a shader object from vertex shader source code and pixel shader source code.
member.param: A string containing the vertex shader source.
A string containing the pixel (fragment) shader source code.
member.returns: A shader program object identifying the combination of the given vertex and pixel shader.
member.remarks: Currently only shaders in GLSL (or rather GLSL/ES) source language(s) are supported. The result is already compiled to code executable on the GPU. to activate the result as the current shader used for rendering geometry passed to the RenderContext.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.GetShaderParamList(Fusee.Engine.IShaderProgramImp)
member.summary: Get a list of (uniform) shader parameters accessed by the given shader.
member.param: The shader program to query for parameters.
member.returns: A list of shader parameters accessed by the shader code of the given shader program. The parameters listed here are the so-called uniform parameters of the shader (in contrast to the varying parameters). The list contains all uniform parameters that are accessed by either the vertex shader, the pixel shader, or both shaders compiled into the given shader.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.GetShaderParam(Fusee.Engine.IShaderProgramImp,System.String)
member.summary: Returns an identifiyer for the named (uniform) parameter used in the specified shader program.
member.param: The shader program using the parameter.
member.returns: A handle object to identify the given parameter in subsequent calls to SetShaderParam.
member.remarks: The returned handle can be used to assign values to a (uniform) shader paramter.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.GetParamValue(Fusee.Engine.IShaderProgramImp,Fusee.Engine.IShaderParam)
member.summary: Gets the value of a shader parameter.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.SetShaderParam(Fusee.Engine.IShaderParam,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the specified shader parameter to a float value.
member.param: The float value that should be assigned to the shader parameter.
member.remarks: to see how to retrieve an identifier for a given uniform parameter name used in a shader program.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.SetShaderParam(Fusee.Engine.IShaderParam,Fusee.Math.float2)
member.summary: Sets the shader parameter to a float2 value.
member.param: The float2 value that should be assigned to the shader parameter.
member.remarks: to see how to retrieve an identifier for a given uniform parameter name used in a shader program.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.SetShaderParam(Fusee.Engine.IShaderParam,Fusee.Math.float3)
member.summary: Sets the shader parameter to a float3 value.
member.param: The float3 value that should be assigned to the shader parameter.
member.remarks: to see how to retrieve an identifier for a given uniform parameter name used in a shader program.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.SetShaderParam(Fusee.Engine.IShaderParam,Fusee.Math.float4)
member.summary: Sets the shader parameter to a float4 value.
member.param: The float4 value that should be assigned to the shader parameter.
member.remarks: to see how to retrieve an identifier for a given uniform parameter name used in a shader program.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.SetShaderParam(Fusee.Engine.IShaderParam,Fusee.Math.float4x4)
member.summary: Sets the shader parameter to a float4x4 matrixvalue.
member.param: The float4x4 matrix that should be assigned to the shader parameter.
member.remarks: to see how to retrieve an identifier for a given uniform parameter name used in a shader program.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.SetShaderParam(Fusee.Engine.IShaderParam,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the shader parameter to a integer value.
member.param: The integer value that should be assigned to the shader parameter.
member.remarks: to see how to retrieve an identifier for a given uniform parameter name used in a shader program.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.SetShaderParamTexture(Fusee.Engine.IShaderParam,Fusee.Engine.ITexture)
member.summary: Sets a Shader Parameter to a created texture.
member.param: Shader Parameter used for texture binding.
An ITexture probably returned from CreateTexture() method.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.CreateTexture(Fusee.Engine.ImageData)
member.summary: Creates a new texture and binds it to the shader.
member.remarks: Method should be called after LoadImage method to process the BitmapData an make them available for the shader.
member.param: An ImageData struct, containing necessary information for the upload to the graphics card.
member.returns: An ITexture that can be used for texturing in the shader.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.LoadImage(System.String)
member.summary: Loads an image file from disk and creates a new Bitmap-object out of it.
member.remarks: This is the first step for the texturing Process. The Bitmap-bits get locked in the memory and are made available for further processing. The returned ImageData-Struct can be used in the CreateTexture method.
member.returns: An ImageData struct with all necessary information for the texture-binding process.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.CreateImage(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new Image with a specified size and color.
member.param: The color of the image. Value must be JS compatible.
member.returns: An ImageData struct containing all necessary information for further processing.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.TextOnImage(Fusee.Engine.ImageData,System.String,System.Single,System.String,System.String,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Maps a text in a specific font on an image.
member.param: The ImageData struct with the PixelData from the image.
The text that sould be mapped on the iamge.
The horizontal start-position of the text on the image.
The vertical start-position of the text on the image.
member.returns: An ImageData struct containing all necessary information for further processing

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.LoadFont(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Loads a font file (*.ttf) and processes it with the given font size.
member.returns: An containing all necessary information for further processing.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.FixTextKerning(Fusee.Engine.IFont,Fusee.Math.float3[],System.String,System.Single)
member.summary: Fixes the kerning of a text (if possible).
member.param: The containing information about the font.
member.returns: The fixed vertices as an array of .

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.Clear(Fusee.Engine.ClearFlags)
member.summary: Erases the contents of the speciefied rendering buffers.
member.param: A combination of flags specifying the rendering buffers to clear.
member.remarks: Calling this method erases all contents of the rendering buffers. A typical use case for this method is to erase the contents of the color buffer and the depth buffer (z-buffer) before rendering starts at the beginning of a rendering loop. Thus, rendering the current frame starts with an empty color and z-buffer. for a list of possible buffers to clear. Make sure to use the bitwisee or-operator (|) to combine several buffers to clear.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.SetVertices(Fusee.Engine.IMeshImp,Fusee.Math.float3[])
member.summary: Binds the vertices onto the GL Rendercontext and assigns an VertexBuffer index to the passed instance.
member.exception: Vertices must not be null or empty

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.SetNormals(Fusee.Engine.IMeshImp,Fusee.Math.float3[])
member.summary: Binds the normals onto the GL Rendercontext and assigns an NormalBuffer index to the passed instance.
member.exception: Normals must not be null or empty

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.SetUVs(Fusee.Engine.IMeshImp,Fusee.Math.float2[])
member.summary: Binds the UV coordinates onto the GL Rendercontext and assigns an UVBuffer index to the passed instance.
member.exception: UVs must not be null or empty

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.SetColors(Fusee.Engine.IMeshImp,System.UInt32[])
member.summary: Binds the colors onto the GL Rendercontext and assigns an ColorBuffer index to the passed instance.
member.exception: colors must not be null or empty

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.SetTriangles(Fusee.Engine.IMeshImp,System.UInt16[])
member.summary: Binds the triangles onto the GL Rendercontext and assigns an ElementBuffer index to the passed instance.
member.exception: triangleIndices must not be null or empty

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.SetShader(Fusee.Engine.IShaderProgramImp)
member.summary: Activates the passed shader program as the current shader for geometry rendering.
member.param: The shader to apply to mesh geometry subsequently passed to the RenderContext

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.Viewport(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the rectangular output region within the output buffer(s).
member.param: leftmost pixel of the rectangular output region within the output buffer.
topmost pixel of the rectangular output region within the output buffer.
horizontal size (in pixels) of the output region.
vertical size (in pixels) of the ouput region.
member.remarks: Setting the Viewport limits the rendering ouptut to the specified rectangular region.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.ColorMask(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable Color channels to be written to the frame buffer (final image). Use this function as a color channel filter for the final image.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.Frustum(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Specify the View Frustum by settings its left,right,bottom,top,near and far planes. Image the View frustum as a cubical form that determines the Cameras 3D view along its far plane.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.Render(Fusee.Engine.IMeshImp)
member.summary: Renders the specified mesh.
member.param: The mesh that should be rendered.
member.remarks: Passes geometry to be pushed through the rendering pipeline. for a description how geometry is made up. The geometry is transformed and rendered by the currently active shader program.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.DebugLine(Fusee.Math.float3,Fusee.Math.float3,Fusee.Math.float4)
member.summary: Draws a Debug Line in 3D Space by using a start and end point (float3).

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.CreateMeshImp
member.summary: Creates the mesh implementation.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.ModelView
member.summary: The ModelView matrix used by the rendering pipeline.
member.value: The 4x4 ModelView matrix defining the transformation applied to model coordinates yielding view coordinates.
member.remarks: Model coordinates are the coordinates directly taken from the model (the mesh geometry - ). The rendering pipeline transforms these coordinates into View coordinates. Further down the pipeline the coordinates will be transformed to screen coordinates to allow the geometry to be rendered to pixel positions on the screen. The ModelView matrix defines the transformations performed on the original model coordinates to yield view coordinates. In most cases the matrix is a composition of several translations, rotations, and scale operations.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.Projection
member.summary: The projection matrix used by the rendering pipeline
member.value: The 4x4 projection matrix applied to view coordinates yielding clip space coordinates.
member.remarks: View coordinates are the result of the ModelView matrix multiplied to the geometry (). The coordinate system of the view space has its origin in the camera center with the z axis aligned to the viewing direction, and the x- and y axes aligned to the viewing plane. Still, no projection from 3d space to the viewing plane has been performed. This is done by multiplying view coordinate geometry wihth the projection matrix. Typically, the projection matrix either performs a parallel projection or a perspective projection.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.ClearColor
member.summary: The color to use when clearing the color buffer.
member.value: The color value is interpreted as a (Red, Green, Blue, Alpha) quadruple with component values ranging from 0.0f to 1.0f.
member.remarks: This is the color that will be copied to all pixels in the output color buffer when Clear is called on the render context.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.IRenderContextImp.ClearDepth
member.summary: The depth value to use when clearing the color buffer.
member.value: Typically set to the highest possible depth value. Typically ranges between 0 and 1.
member.remarks: This is the depth (z-) value that will be copied to all pixels in the depth (z-) buffer when Clear is called on the render context.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.IShaderParam
member.summary: This is a markup-only for different types of handling shader parameters. The implementation is render-platform specific and differs among platforms like OpenGL, DirectX, or WebGL

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.IShaderProgramImp
member.summary: The Shaderprogram interface. It is currently in prototype state.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.IAudioImp
member.summary: Interface for the Audio implementation. The implementation of this interface is responsible for management of all instances. This is used as a container for all the and handles Sound functions globally.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IAudioImp.OpenDevice
member.summary: Implementation Tasks: Opens the device. All derivate instances have to be wiped and the globalvolume of a Listener(if 3D Sound is intended) can be set to maximum.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IAudioImp.CloseDevice
member.summary: Implementation Tasks: Closes the device. All instances of derivate have to be disposed in order to free up memory.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IAudioImp.LoadFile(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Implementation Tasks: Loads the specified file from an external source (examples: hard drive, network, etc) into memory for usage inside of the application.
member.param: Name of the file that should include the file type ending and a absolute or relative path, e.g. C:\sound.ogg .
member.returns: A derivate of should be returned upon succesful filepath resolution.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IAudioImp.Stop
member.summary: Implementation Tasks: Stops all derivates playbacks that this instance is responsible for.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IAudioImp.SetVolume(System.Single)
member.summary: Implemenation Tasks: Sets the global volume of the application. In 3D Sound usually a Listener is used to accomplish this task. In 2D Sound a simple iteration through all derivates that this instance is responsible for is sufficient.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IAudioImp.GetVolume
member.summary: Implementation Tasks: Gets the global volume of the application. In 3D Sound a Listener is usually used to accomplish this task. In 2D Sound an internal master volume property can be implemented that handles all derivates volumes that this instance is responsible for.

member.name: M:Fusee.Engine.IAudioImp.SetPanning(System.Single)
member.summary: Implemenation Tasks: Sets the panning for all derivates that this instance is responsible for.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.ITexture
member.summary: This is a markup-only for different types of Texture-handles. The implementation is render-platform specific: e.g. int in OpenGL, ISurface in DirectX, TextureObject in WebGL, ...

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.KeyEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the KeyDown or KeyUp event.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.KeyEventArgs.Shift
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is shift.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is alt.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.KeyEventArgs.Control
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is control.

member.name: P:Fusee.Engine.KeyEventArgs.KeyCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the key code.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.LightType
member.summary: Specifies the type of the light. A light is specified by one of three types represented by integers between 0 and 2.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.LightType.Directional
member.summary: Directional light is represented by 0.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.LightType.Point
member.summary: Point light is represented by 1.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.LightType.Spot
member.summary: Spot light is represented by 2.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.Light
member.summary: The container that holds all informations that are required for shader light calculation.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.Light.Active
member.summary: Represents the light status.

member.summary: Represents the ambient color.

member.summary: Represents the diffuse color.

member.summary: Represents the specular color.

member.summary: Represents the position of the light.

member.summary: Represents the direction of the light.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.Light.Type
member.summary: Represents the type of the light.

member.name: F:Fusee.Engine.Light.Angle
member.summary: Represents the spot angle of the light.

member.summary: Gets or sets the button.

member.summary: Sets a point in 3D space.

member.summary: The x-coordinate

member.summary: The y-coordinate

member.summary: The z-coordinate

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.RenderState
member.summary: The render state enumeration. This is used in render context implementations to identify the render state to set. Keep this binary compatible with DirectX version 9.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.BlendOperation
member.summary: Specifies the per-pixel blend-operation to perform when alpha blending is enabled.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.Compare
member.summary: Specifies the comparison tests to perform in Z-Buffer and in Stencil tests

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.Cull
member.summary: Specifies if and how triangle culling should be performed. If no culling is specified, triangles are rendered, no matter how they are oriented. Clockwise and Counterclockwise culling refers to in which order a triangle's vertices appear on the screen. If either is specified, triangles in the respective order are culled.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.Blend
member.summary: Used to define the source and destination blending factors. Together, these specify the blend operation to be used when writing a pixel color value onto the render canvas.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.FillMode
member.summary: Specifies the fill mode to use by the rasterizer. Options are Point (renders vertices as single pixels), Wireframe (renders only triangles' edges as lines), or Solid (fills all pixels covered by triangles).

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.ClearFlags
member.summary: Specifies the buffer to use when calling the Clear method.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.KeyCodes
member.summary: Specifies the possible key values on a keyboard.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.MouseButtons
member.summary: Specifies constants that define which mouse button was pressed.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.InputAxis
member.summary: Specifies the axis type.

member.name: T:Fusee.Engine.CursorType
member.summary: The different cursor types directly supported by render canvas implementations Standard pointer and link-hand cursor are currently supported.
